results.title: Protist physiology (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Examines the internal processes of independently living cells, including mechanisms for phagocytosis and digestion, and for saprozoic and autotrophic nutrition. Describes symbiotic associations between autotrophs and heterotrophs and methods of water balance.

results.title: A New look at Leeuwenhoek's wee beasties (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of the Series “Inhabitants of the planet earth”
Examines free-living protists as viewed in natural time by differential interference cinemicrography. Discusses the classification and general characteristics of flagellates, amoebas, and ciliates.

results.title: Coelenterates (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Biomedia Associates and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Focuses on a hydra capturing a daphnia. Compares the reproduction methods of the hydra and obelia. Shows closeups of the physalia and limestone producing polyps in stony corals. Written and photographed by Bruce J. Russell.

results.title: Annelids (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Modern Learning Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
A small anaesthetised earthworm is shown dissected, featuring the pumping heart. Shows peristaltic contractions which mix the food and send it along the intestinal tract. Undigested “castings” are expelled and their importance in soil ecology is discussed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Modern Learning Aids

results.title: Protect your back
results.creator_credit: Jane Nicholls and Yoralla Society of Victoria
results.brief_description: Demonstrates safe lifting practices for families, friends and service providers of people with disabilities in community based environments. Overviews how the back works, risk factors and correct lifting practices. Provides guidelines for when the person being asisted can help or cannot communicate and assistance techniques including seating adjustment, discussing the lift, adjusting position in bed, transferring, assisted walking and lifting in a team.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Nicholls and Yoralla Society of Victoria

results.title: Proof of power
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Ford Motor Company, this film deals with the scientific measurement of tractor power, and its application in primary production. The American sequence is included by courtesy of the University of Nebraska, USA.

results.title: Programming controlling producing
results.brief_description: Studies the Index factories in West Germany, and the machines they make. Their designs are shown, and the major components of their Automatic engines are examined.
results.description: Studies the Index factories in West Germany, and the machines they make. Their designs are shown, and the major components of their Automatic engines are examined.

results.title: Profiles of elementary physical education
results.brief_description: Methods in teaching physical education and guiding class activities for kindergarten through elementary grades. Starting with kindergarten and carrying through the elementary grades this film stresses the successful methods used in the teaching of physical education. It urges careful organisation and presents many ideas for the guidance of class activities. Based on the physical education program of Cleveland schools, this film is invaluable to the beginning as well as to the experienced teacher of physical education in any elementary school system.
